ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Haste tests... Swirlspine Belt?
ygData.msgSnippet: Haven t tested it myself, but from what all of my friends say that have compared the two I hear SS is slower. Draw your own conclusions though. Try that test
ygData.messageBody:
Haven't tested it myself, but from what all of my friends say that have
compared the two I hear SS is slower. Draw your own conclusions though. Try
that test that John posted maybe. I tend to not believe everything I
see/hear/read unless I see evidence myself, so to me it's still up in the
air. Personally I'll probly give my rogue my FBSS and get a TBB until I can
get a Belt of Concordance since I seem to get Swift Like the Wind even when
I don't ask for it (which I never do, actually).

Sartori D'Elsiraad <Legion>
50th Bard of Veeshan


>From: "Marc Allie" <marcallie@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@egroups.com
>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Haste tests... Swirlspine Belt?
>Date: Tue, 04 Apr 2000 18:16:10 -0000
>
>I am curious as to how the Swirlspine Belt figures into all this.
>I have heard rumors that it is both faster than, the same, and slower
>than the FBSS. Anyone have one they could try out? If it is indeed
>the same haste %, then by far it is better than the FBSS.
>
>This is interesting, I have a monk friend who has some Cape off of
>Innoruuk that gives what he says is 30% haste, he might be interested
>to know that my lil' old Verses of Celerity might indeed give him
>maximum haste.
>
>Wonder how monk attacks like Dragon Punch and Flying Kick, and also
>Backstab figure into the equation.
>
>Pistov Kazidaizahlot
>Bard of 40 Songs
>Cazic Thule
>"If I loot too much, kick me."
>
